Key Match Events: Charlie Blackmon's two-run home run in the second inning was the 227th of his 14-year career, tying Carlos Gonzalez for the fifth in franchise history.
Ezequiel Tovar's two-run, game-tying double was the catalyst of a five-run eighth inning for the Rockies.
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon expressed his desire to enjoy the last three games of his career and remember as much as he can.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies will need to win two out of three games against the Los Angeles Dodgers this weekend to avoid the second 100-loss season in the franchise's 31-year history.
Others: The loss snapped a four-game win streak for the Cardinals, who need one more victory to secure their 23rd winning season in the last 25 years.
